hypothesis_content.title: Term Structure Flattening Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: When the BTC volatility term structure (30D IV / 7D IV) flattens to below 0.85 (near-term vol approaches longer-term vol) during a NEUTRAL or STRESS regime, it indicates exhaustion of short-term volatility events, predicting mean reversion in spot price over the next 2-3 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: A flattened term structure suggests short-dated volatility premium has been exhausted, often coinciding with peak fear/greed. When combined with an overextended price, it signals a high-probability snapback as the immediate catalyst for the move dissipates.
entry_conditions: BTC price is >1.5 standard deviations from its 20-day SMA (overextended)
Enter in direction of mean reversion (towards 20D SMA)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves another 1.5 std deviations away from SMA in the wrong direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price continues trending away from its 20-day SMA for more than 60% of signals after the flattening condition is met.
